post.body: Despite being right wing I actually am against the Death Penalty. Only because an estimated 4% of people on death row are innocent.
post.body_html: Despite being right wing I actually am against the Death Penalty. Only because an estimated 4% of people on death row are innocent.
post.title: Whats your stance on the Death Penalty?

body: I think it's necessary, but needs to have stipulations for it's use to prevent it from accidentally executing innocents. If there is zero chance of the suit being overturned, for example someone being caught in the act of a heinous crime, then I feel it's appropriate. When we know the individual cannot be rehabilitated with no chance of parole, or serving an insane life sentence like 300 years, what point do we have to retain that individual in Prison? It's necessary, but it should be rare.
body_html: I think it's necessary, but needs to have stipulations for it's use to prevent it from accidentally executing innocents. If there is zero chance of the suit being overturned, for example someone being caught in the act of a heinous crime, then I feel it's appropriate. When we know the individual cannot be rehabilitated with no chance of parole, or serving an insane life sentence like 300 years, what point do we have to retain that individual in Prison? It's necessary, but it should be rare.

post.body: Despite being right wing I actually am against the Death Penalty. Only because an estimated 4% of people on death row are innocent.
post.body_html: Despite being right wing I actually am against the Death Penalty. Only because an estimated 4% of people on death row are innocent.
post.title: Whats your stance on the Death Penalty?

body: I am pro death penalty because I believe it's more merciful to kill people convicted if serious crimes than I do keeping them in prison for decades. Even if they're actually innocent. I say that as someone who would gladly choose the needle over decades of rape, torture, enslavement and legal battles if I was ever imprisoned for a crime I either didn't commit or was justified in committing.
body_html: I am pro death penalty because I believe it's more merciful to kill people convicted if serious crimes than I do keeping them in prison for decades. Even if they're actually innocent. I say that as someone who would gladly choose the needle over decades of rape, torture, enslavement and legal battles if I was ever imprisoned for a crime I either didn't commit or was justified in committing.

post.body: Despite being right wing I actually am against the Death Penalty. Only because an estimated 4% of people on death row are innocent.
post.body_html: Despite being right wing I actually am against the Death Penalty. Only because an estimated 4% of people on death row are innocent.
post.title: Whats your stance on the Death Penalty?

body:
I'm for it in theory, but as I do not trust humanity to be a good judge of who should live or die, I'm against it in practice.

The only killing I support is directly in defense of yourself or another.
body_html:
I'm for it in theory, but as I do not trust humanity to be a good judge of who should live or die, I'm against it in practice.

The only killing I support is directly in defense of yourself or another.

author.bio: The man behind the internet meme thingy named FunnyMemeSpot. I meme, that’s just what I do.
author.bio_html: The man behind the internet meme thingy named FunnyMemeSpot. I meme, that’s just what I do.

body:
I tend to have a who is the government to judge attitude, if the government worked properly and could properly do its job then I’d be all for it but given how fucked up the prison system is, and that we can’t seem to figure out a good way to do it without having some dude on the row for 67 years or some shit, (I say firing squad, if done right it’s painless and we’ll never run out of the drugs for it), 

Some crimes are horrid enough to warrant it, (like some particularly bad murders and a bunch of other things).
body_html:
I tend to have a who is the government to judge attitude, if the government worked properly and could properly do its job then I’d be all for it but given how fucked up the prison system is, and that we can’t seem to figure out a good way to do it without having some dude on the row for 67 years or some shit, (I say firing squad, if done right it’s painless and we’ll never run out of the drugs for it),

Some crimes are horrid enough to warrant it, (like some particularly bad murders and a bunch of other things).

body: I flip flopped on this for a while, but reading the Charles Manson case makes me think there are just some criminals that require the death penalty. I mention his case in particular because the nature of his crimes means that he can corrupt people from within prison. See the women he married in prison. See also all the other serial killers that got married in prison.

I mention his case in particular because the nature of his crimes means that he can corrupt people from within prison. See the women he married in prison. See also all the other serial killers that got married in prison.

body:
Only in cases where there is proof, genuine confession, or very, very, *very* damning evidence where no sane person can have doubt. So pretty limited in use.

Philosophically speaking though, if we are to assume that we know for certain someone committed an unjustifiable murder, to the firing squad. Charge their remaining family for the bullets used
body_html:
Only in cases where there is proof, genuine confession, or very, very, very damning evidence where no sane person can have doubt. So pretty limited in use.

Philosophically speaking though, if we are to assume that we know for certain someone committed an unjustifiable murder, to the firing squad. Charge their remaining family for the bullets used

post.body: Despite being right wing I actually am against the Death Penalty. Only because an estimated 4% of people on death row are innocent.
post.body_html: Despite being right wing I actually am against the Death Penalty. Only because an estimated 4% of people on death row are innocent.
post.title: Whats your stance on the Death Penalty?

author.bio: I am a person. I don't k PW what I am PR what the world is but I am figuring that out, just like you.
author.bio_html: I am a person. I don't k PW what I am PR what the world is but I am figuring that out, just like you.

body:
For me, the death penalty is not so much a penalty as it is the removal of the destructive element from society. It is a deterrent, but some people still break laws knowing that doing so can get them killed but they do it anyway. You must remove those people from society.

The death penalty is a part of a broader system of corporal punishment that I think should be adopted. Prison is barbaric and counterproductive. In an ideal society there would be no victimless crimes, and so all crimes will be coercive in nature. If that can be accomplished, punishments could be financial restitution for non violent crimes and corporal punishment for violent crimes. For particularly heinous crimes for which people generally think a person should not be a part of our society, killing them would be the best option. I can see some type of arrangement where death would only occur on a second offense so as to protect people who are wrongfully convicted.
body_html:
For me, the death penalty is not so much a penalty as it is the removal of the destructive element from society. It is a deterrent, but some people still break laws knowing that doing so can get them killed but they do it anyway. You must remove those people from society.

The death penalty is a part of a broader system of corporal punishment that I think should be adopted. Prison is barbaric and counterproductive. In an ideal society there would be no victimless crimes, and so all crimes will be coercive in nature. If that can be accomplished, punishments could be financial restitution for non violent crimes and corporal punishment for violent crimes. For particularly heinous crimes for which people generally think a person should not be a part of our society, killing them would be the best option. I can see some type of arrangement where death would only occur on a second offense so as to protect people who are wrongfully convicted.

post.body: Despite being right wing I actually am against the Death Penalty. Only because an estimated 4% of people on death row are innocent.
post.body_html: Despite being right wing I actually am against the Death Penalty. Only because an estimated 4% of people on death row are innocent.
post.title: Whats your stance on the Death Penalty?

body: Against in theory and in practice. As for the practical part, government can screw it up, the justice system can screw it up, and I don't think death is the worst possible outcome for a person. Are you more scared of dying on a chair in minutes or live 50 years in prison with no legal way out? As for the theoretical part, we shouldn't kill people. That's the easiest way I can put it. If killing people is bad and therefore punishable by death, we are not in any way better.
body_html: Against in theory and in practice. As for the practical part, government can screw it up, the justice system can screw it up, and I don't think death is the worst possible outcome for a person. Are you more scared of dying on a chair in minutes or live 50 years in prison with no legal way out? As for the theoretical part, we shouldn't kill people. That's the easiest way I can put it. If killing people is bad and therefore punishable by death, we are not in any way better.

body:
In cases where guilt is beyond shadow of doubt, I'm 100% for it. There's no such thing squeals the libtard! Bullshit says I. Around twenty years ago some mad dog got on a train, started shooting people, ran out of ammo, was wrestled to the floor, and held til police arrived. I'm sure there are plenty of similar examples. Noooo squeals the libtard, he was crazy and not responsible. Don't care says I...sane enough to figure out how to kill a bunch of people...sane enough for his ass to die for it. 

In cases where guilt is not beyond shadow of doubt, I'm for using every means (yes, including expensive DNA testing) to determine guilt or innocence...and keeping his ass in prison until it is determined. Then either let him go, or bury him.
body_html:
In cases where guilt is beyond shadow of doubt, I'm 100% for it. There's no such thing squeals the libtard! Bullshit says I. Around twenty years ago some mad dog got on a train, started shooting people, ran out of ammo, was wrestled to the floor, and held til police arrived. I'm sure there are plenty of similar examples. Noooo squeals the libtard, he was crazy and not responsible. Don't care says I...sane enough to figure out how to kill a bunch of people...sane enough for his ass to die for it.

In cases where guilt is not beyond shadow of doubt, I'm for using every means (yes, including expensive DNA testing) to determine guilt or innocence...and keeping his ass in prison until it is determined. Then either let him go, or bury him.
